image.altText: The outside of the NAAJA building in Darwin.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's top Aboriginal legal services, NAAJA, has publicly apologised for the unlawful sacking of former chief executive officer Priscilla Atkins.

title.children: Aboriginal legal service NAAJA apologises for 'hurt' caused by unlawful sacking of CEO

image.altText: Nicole Manison

props.synopsis: Nicole Manison's Territory Labor government recently signed a major gas contract with US-owned company Tamboran Resources, and she spruiked the firm when she was mining minister.

title.children: Former NT deputy chief minister takes up role with fracking company she spruiked in government

image.altText: A framed photo of Nick Dondas

props.synopsis: Former MLA Nick Dondas, who dedicated more than two decades of his life to public service, has been remembered as a "larger-than-life character" and a "true territory icon".

title.children: 'Father of Marrara': Former NT deputy chief minister remembered for contribution to politics, sport and community

image.altText: A close-up of someone wearing a camouflage US Marines uniform.

props.synopsis: A US marine attempting to sue his own government after he was "engulfed in flames" in a barbecue explosion while stationed in Darwin has had a ruling in his favour overturned on appeal.

title.children: US marine burned by exploding barbecue suffers appeal setback in lawsuit against own government

image.altText: An aerial shot of a country town surrounded by trees and the outback.

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old has become the fourth woman killed in the NT's Big Rivers region in four months and the eighth person in the territory to die allegedly at the hands of a loved one since June.

title.children: Katherine domestic violence assault charge set to be upgraded to murder

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja chairing the domestic violence royal commission.

props.synopsis: In the space of a single week, four women were killed in separate and unrelated incidents in SA. A year on, the state's royal commission has heard that there are not adequate services to keep up with the increase in domestic violence cases.

title.children: Domestic violence royal commission begins hearings a year after 'worst week in any jurisdiction'

image.altText: A man's side profile.

props.synopsis: The government says a controversial ministerial directive will remain in place if it cannot pass its bill to cap international student enrolments from next year — a likely scenario due to the Coalition announcing it will vote against it.

title.children: Regional universities warn of 'disastrous' consequences if scheme to manage student visas remains in place

image.altText: a smiling man wearing a pink shirt crouching next to two dogs

props.synopsis: After a long period of administration, the Barkly Regional Council has welcomed a new mayor with a fresh vision for Tennant Creek and surrounds, along with 12 other newly elected members.

title.children: New era for troubled NT outback council as mayor pledges to rebuild trust and tackle stalled projects

image.altText: A woman in a white dress posing.

props.synopsis: Art and designs from the remote outback town have graced catwalks in Paris, New York and Melbourne. What's driving this trend?

title.children: Fitzroy Crossing is becoming a fashion phenomenon with models, artists and designers

image.altText: The eye of a crocodile in green water

props.synopsis: The man was attacked while spearfishing on Western Australia's remote Dampier Peninsula and hit the animal in order to get away, according to senior rangers.

title.children: Kimberley man punched crocodile in nose to escape attack, ranger says

image.altText: A composite image of a ballerina and her parents shielding themselves with jackets

props.synopsis: The parents of a malnourished Perth teenager doctors warned would die without medical help have been found guilty of starving her.

title.children: Parents guilty of starving their emaciated teenage daughter who they treated like a 'little girl'

image.altText: Palestinians with backpack cary household items as they flee along an unsealed road that runs between damaged buildings.

props.synopsis: The IDF's siege of northern Gaza is now into its second month, leading many to question whether Israel has adopted a controversial plan to conquer the area.

title.children: Former IDF general wants to encircle and starve out those remaining in northern Gaza

image.altText: Gail Ferrari-Hirst and Russell Hirst embrace while standing

props.synopsis: Just 18 days before Russell Wayne Hirst died of a cardiac event in November 2021, superannuation giant Cbus cancelled his insurance policy, leaving the beneficiary of his account in a year-long fight to have her claim approved.

title.children: 'Absolutely unacceptable': Cbus cancels customer's insurance days before his death

image.altText: Photo of a young woman with red hair and nose piercings

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Missing Persons Squad have charged a 53-year-old man with murder and a 57-year-old man with assisted murder after the disappearance of 19-year-old Brunswick woman Isla Bell.

title.children: Man charged with murder after human remains found at a tip during search for missing Melbourne teenager Isla Bell

image.altText: Socceroos players walk slowly with their heads down

props.synopsis: The Socceroos managed 21 shots on target in their last two internationals, but scored just twice. Tony Popovic's side can ill afford such profligacy in front of goal in a desperately tight World Cup qualification group.

title.children: The Socceroos were once again wasteful against Bahrain — and it could cost them dearly

image.altText: A bird's eye view of unit blocks and apartments with the ocean in the background on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The typical household faces spending half their income to service a new home loan, according to research from ANZ and CoreLogic, while the Australian share market ended lower.

title.children: Housing affordability deteriorates further, ASX retreats from record high — as it happened

image.altText: Central Station in Sydney

props.synopsis: Industrial action will freeze all train services across Greater Sydney from Friday to Sunday morning. Here is what the strike means for commuters.

title.children: Sydney's looming train shutdown set to cause 'massive disruption'

image.altText: A woman with short auburn hair looks at the ground while walking through a door

props.synopsis: The Frenchwoman and her ex-husband have given their final statements in court as the mass rape trial involving 51 men enters its final stages.

title.children: Gisele Pelicot says mass rape trial of 51 men is one of 'cowardice'

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A jury is considering its verdict in Senior Constable Kristian White's manslaughter trial. The police officer tasered great-grandmother Clare Nowland, who later died in hospital.

title.children: Jury retires to consider fate of NSW police officer who tasered a 95yo woman

image.altText: Backs of school students in uniform

props.synopsis: Hackers are increasingly eyeing private schools as a "honey pot" for ransomware, with the average cost of cybercrime to small businesses hitting almost $50,000.

title.children: Hackers targeting private schools as authorities warn of 'evolving' cyber threats

image.altText: Boulevard of trees in central Melbourne

props.synopsis: Research shows Melbourne and Sydney are failing to meet the "bare minimum" standard for nature in cities based on "3-30-300" guidelines that assess tree visibility, canopy cover and access to parks.

title.children: Major Australian cities fail to pass 'bare minimum' nature standards

image.altText: Trump attends SpaceX's launch of world's most powerful rocket

props.synopsis: SpaceX has aborted an attempt to catch the first stage booster of its Starship mega rocket in the "chopstick" arms of its launch tower in an ocean splashdown.

title.children: SpaceX fails to catch megarocket in 'chopstick' arms as Trump, Musk look on

image.altText: A red helicopter landing on a bitumen helipad in front of bushland.

props.synopsis: The woman needed hospital treatment after suffering a late-night haemorrhage on Magnetic Island earlier this month, but the region's rescue helicopter was unavailable.

title.children: 'Traumatised' woman endures four-hour wait for island medical evacuation due to chopper shortage

image.altText: A dark-haired woman wearing a white top.

props.synopsis: A Victorian woman who killed her husband by feeding him temazepam-laced lemon biscuits before stuffing him in a freezer has had her murder sentence reduced to 12 years behind bars.

title.children: Woman who murdered her husband with drugged biscuits has jail sentence reduced

image.altText: Hip hop group 3% on stage at the 2024 ARIA awards accepting an award

props.synopsis: First Nations artists win big at an ARIA Awards ceremony that celebrates the breadth of Australian music.

title.children: 'We're taking them all home': First Nations artists shine at 2024 ARIA Awards

image.altText: A stylised image of Ricky Ponting, Brett Lee, Sophie Molineux and Dean Jones.

props.synopsis: This summer, ABC Sport is looking for the most memorable cricket moment between Australia and India, as voted by the readers. Cast your votes now in our online poll.

title.children: Vote now for what you think is the most memorable moment in Australia vs India cricket history

image.altText: A smiling woman wears blue dress, blonde hair, holds a young cow, stands in front of iron gates latched with iron chains.

props.synopsis: The Farrells have run cattle on their rural property for more than 100 years and are now excited about renewables and the next phase of their family legacy.

title.children: Farmer says yes to wind project to 'keep farm in the family' but some question environmental impact

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits in an office with brightly coloured wallpaper behind her

props.synopsis: The prolific wallpaper designer reinvented herself many times and embroidered her biography. But years after her death, her murderer is still unknown.

title.children: Glamorous designer Florence Broadhurst's secrets came out at her funeral, but her killer remains unknown

image.altText: A "sorry we're closed" sign in the window of a shopfront.

props.synopsis: The rate of business failures is now the highest it has been since the COVID-19 pandemic, and it is only set to grow as the cost of doing business squeezes companies from all sides.

title.children: Businesses are failing at near the highest rate on record

image.altText: Vladimir Putin wearing a dark suit, tie and blue shirt sitting emotionless at a wooden desk in front of a Russian flag

props.synopsis: The new doctrine says the Kremlin would consider a nuclear strike in response to the use of conventional weapons against Russia or Belarus.

title.children: Vladimir Putin lowers Russia's threshold for using nuclear weapons

image.altText: Smokey rubble with house in background

props.synopsis: G20 summit calls for peace in the Ukraine-Russia and Middle East war, just before Russia claimed Ukraine had begun launching American-made long-range missiles into its territory.

title.children: World leaders call for peace in Ukraine-Russia war and Middle East

image.altText: A man holding tarot cards

props.synopsis: It is alleged that the syndicate had been operating in the Sydney area as far back as 2006 and had defrauded at least four victims out of large amounts of money and property.

title.children: Sydney psychics charged with fraud, tarot cards and crystal balls seized by police

image.altText: AFL draftee Sam Lalor stands on stage holding a Richmond guernsey next to former Tigers captain Trent Cotchin.

props.synopsis: The time has come for the next generation of AFL stars to find their teams. Follow live as all 18 clubs make their selections in the first round of the 2024 draft.

title.children: Richmond takes Sam Lalor with number one pick of 2024 AFL draft

image.altText: Two women hold a rainbow flag in Canberra's Haig Park.

props.synopsis: Recent studies put the number of gen Zs identifying as LGBTQIA+ at close to double the rate of Australia's older adult population groups.

title.children: Increasing number of gen Zs identifying as LGBTQIA+, studies show

image.altText: Woman wearing a white sundress with brown hair.

props.synopsis: More than 3,000 children who contact Kids Helpline every year report being bullied. A new school behaviour and management plan to be implemented by term one, 2025 will make it mandatory for NSW schools to identify, prevent and respond to disruptive student behaviours, including bullying and cyberbullying.

title.children: Parents move their kids to new schools as teachers fail to deal with bullies
